page.title: 12Galloway News
page.content: In July 1858 the Kirkcudbright Advertiser now known as the Galloway News was founded. The printers now in Dumfries used to be in the Castle Douglas office. They moved to make more room. The Dumfries office employs 55 people as well as 4 photographers and 1 advertiser. The Galloway News used to be owned by G Outram Ltd. Each week the printers roll out about 8,500 copies. The paper covers mostly the Stewartry District. The working hours of the staff are from 9.00 am to 5.00 pm. The old office is just a couple of yards away from today's office.
